page.title: 09ECOLOGY
page.content: In the area of Weaverham there is a wide selection of{birds.}The most common are the House Sparrows and Starlings. Chaffinches and Greenfinches can often be seen. A common bird is the House Martin which builds on one out of ten houses in every street. Rarer but still seen is the brightly coloured Lesser Spotted Woodpecker. Likewise the Kestrel and the Owl.pretty common are Magpies, Blackbirds, Tits, Jays and Crows. Herons come down the river and catch fish. Swans too can be seen on the Weaver.{Mammals}like Hedgehogs, Squirrels, foxes and badgers are seen at night wandering on the side of the road. Often in the morning they can be seen dead in the road. Rabbits are common in the fields and lots of people have ferrets to go and catch them.
